availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lazarus Noble (Knox County, Indiana, attorney and adjutant general. )

body.p: Knox County, Indiana, attorney and adjutant general. Indiana native. Son of Thomas George Noble and Sarah Jacobs Noble. Married to Catherine Judah Noble. Father of Harriet Noble and Catherine Noble. Deputy clerk in Wayne County, Indiana in 1850. Attorney in Knox County, Indiana in 1860. Employed Ann Palmer as a domestic servant in Knox County, Indiana in 1860. Served as the Adjutant General of Indiana from 1861 to 1864. Elected clerk of the Supreme Court of Indiana in 1864.

ab.bibl:

"City Items," The Indianapolis Star (Indianapolis, IN), January 31, 1865, p. 3.
"Death of General Noble," The Evansville Journal (Evansville, IN), October 22, 1879, p. 4.
Lucius M. Boltwood, History and Genealogy of the Family of Thomas Noble of Westfield, Massachusetts, with Genealogical Notes of Other Families by the Name of Noble (Hartford, CT: Press of the Case, Lockwood, and Brainard Company, 1878) 758.
